entity.name: `<datalist>`
entity.description: Method of providing a list of presets for a user to select in a form control, while still allowing custom options.
entity.descriptionClean: Method of providing a list of presets for a user to select in a form control, while still allowing custom options.
entity.descriptionHtml: Method of providing a list of presets for a user to select in a form control, while still allowing custom options.

mdn.title: <datalist>: The HTML Data List element
mdn.summary: The <datalist> HTML element contains a set of <option> elements that represent the permissible or recommended options available to choose from within other controls.

example.codeHighlighted: <input name="country" list="countries"> <datalist id="countries"> <option>Afghanistan</option> ... </datalist>

entity.name: `input.showPicker()`
entity.description: Programmatically open the picker of form controls that have one (color pickers, date inputs etc).
entity.descriptionClean: Programmatically open the picker of form controls that have one (color pickers, date inputs etc).
entity.descriptionHtml: Programmatically open the picker of form controls that have one (color pickers, date inputs etc).

mdn.title: HTMLInputElement: showPicker() method
mdn.summary: The HTMLInputElement.showPicker() method displays the browser picker for an input element.

example.codeHighlighted: <input id="dateInput" type="date"> <button onclick="dateInput.showPicker()">Select date</button>

entity.name: Customizable Select
entity.description: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously `<selectlist>` and `<selectmenu>`.
entity.descriptionClean: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously <selectlist> and <selectmenu>.
entity.descriptionHtml: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously <selectlist> and <selectmenu>.

example.codeHighlighted: select, ::picker(select) { appearance: base-select; }

entity.name: `<input type="color">`
entity.description: Creates a color picker from which users can choose a color value.
entity.descriptionClean: Creates a color picker from which users can choose a color value.
entity.descriptionHtml: Creates a color picker from which users can choose a color value.

mdn.title: <input type="color">
mdn.summary: <input> elements of type color provide a user interface element that lets a user specify a color, either by using a visual color picker interface or by entering the color into a text field in a CSS color value format.

entity.name: `<input type="color" colorspace="display-p3">`
entity.description: Creates a color picker which allows the user to select a wide-gamut (P3) color.
entity.descriptionClean: Creates a color picker which allows the user to select a wide-gamut (P3) color.
entity.descriptionHtml: Creates a color picker which allows the user to select a wide-gamut (P3) color.

entity.name: `<input type="color" alpha>`
entity.description: Creates a color picker which allows the user to select a semi-transparent color.
entity.descriptionClean: Creates a color picker which allows the user to select a semi-transparent color.
entity.descriptionHtml: Creates a color picker which allows the user to select a semi-transparent color.

entity.name: `contenteditable="plaintext-only"`
entity.description: Permits editing of the element's raw text, but not rich text formatting.
entity.descriptionClean: Permits editing of the element's raw text, but not rich text formatting.
entity.descriptionHtml: Permits editing of the element's raw text, but not rich text formatting.

mdn.title: HTML contenteditable global attribute
mdn.summary: The contenteditable global attribute is an enumerated attribute indicating if the element should be editable by the user. If so, the browser modifies its widget to allow editing.

example.codeHighlighted: <h2 class="title" contenteditable="plaintext-only"></h2>

entity.name: `<details>` and `<summary>`
entity.description: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.
entity.descriptionClean: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.
entity.descriptionHtml: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.

mdn.title: <details>: The Details disclosure element
mdn.summary: The <details> HTML element creates a disclosure widget in which information is visible only when the widget is toggled into an open state. A summary or label must be provided using the <summary> element.

example.codeHighlighted: <details> <summary>Details</summary> Longer content </details>

entity.name: `<details name>` (Exclusive Accordion)
entity.description: Group `<details>` elements so that only up to one in the group can be open at a time.
entity.descriptionClean: Group <details> elements so that only up to one in the group can be open at a time.
entity.descriptionHtml: Group <details> elements so that only up to one in the group can be open at a time.

example.code:
<details open name="sidebar_panel">
	<summary>Main info</summary>
	<!-- controls -->
</details>
<details name="sidebar_panel">
	<summary>Style</summary>
	<!-- controls -->
</details>
example.codeHighlighted: <details open name="sidebar_panel"> <summary>Main info</summary> <!-- controls --> </details> <details name="sidebar_panel"> <summary>Style</summary> <!-- controls --> </details>

entity.name: `<dialog>`
entity.description: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
entity.descriptionClean: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
entity.descriptionHtml: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.

mdn.title: <dialog>: The Dialog element
mdn.summary: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box or other interactive component, such as a dismissible alert, inspector, or subwindow.

example.code:
<dialog id="confirm">
	<form method="dialog">
		Are you sure?
		<button value="1">Yes</button>
		<button value="0">No</button>
	</form>
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <dialog id="confirm"> <form method="dialog"> Are you sure? <button value="1">Yes</button> <button value="0">No</button> </form> </dialog>

entity.name: `<dialog closedby="any">`
entity.description: Allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it (light dismiss).
entity.descriptionClean: Allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it (light dismiss).
entity.descriptionHtml: Allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it (light dismiss).

mdn.title: <dialog>: The Dialog element
mdn.summary: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box or other interactive component, such as a dismissible alert, inspector, or subwindow.

entity.name: `dialog.requestClose()`
entity.description: Closes the dialog in a way that can be cancelled (unlike `dialog.close()`).
entity.descriptionClean: Closes the dialog in a way that can be cancelled (unlike dialog.close()).
entity.descriptionHtml: Closes the dialog in a way that can be cancelled (unlike dialog.close()).

mdn.title: HTMLDialogElement: requestClose() method
mdn.summary:
The requestClose() method of the HTMLDialogElement interface requests to close the <dialog>.
An optional string may be passed as an argument, updating the returnValue of the dialog.

entity.name: `popover` attribute (Popover API)
entity.description: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionClean: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionHtml: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.

mdn.title: Popover API
mdn.summary: The Popover API provides developers with a standard, consistent, flexible mechanism for displaying popover content on top of other page content. Popover content can be controlled either using HTML attributes, or via JavaScript.

example.code: Popover content
example.codeHighlighted: <button popovertarget="foo">Toggle the popover</button> <div id="foo" popover>Popover content</div>

entity.name: `popover="hint"`
entity.description: A way to create less persistent popovers, such as tooltips.
entity.descriptionClean: A way to create less persistent popovers, such as tooltips.
entity.descriptionHtml: A way to create less persistent popovers, such as tooltips.

mdn.title: HTML popover global attribute
mdn.summary: The popover global attribute is used to designate an element as a popover element.

example.code: Save this document
example.codeHighlighted: <div id="tooltip" popover="hint"> Save this document </div> <button popovertarget="tooltip"> Save </button>

entity.name: `command` and `commandfor` attributes (Command Invokers)
entity.description: A declarative way for `<button>` to invoke predefined custom commands.
entity.descriptionClean: A declarative way for <button> to invoke predefined custom commands.
entity.descriptionHtml: A declarative way for <button> to invoke predefined custom commands.

mdn.title: Invoker Commands API
mdn.summary: The Invoker Commands API provides a way to declaratively assign behaviors to buttons, allowing control of interactive elements when the button is enacted (clicked or invoked via a keypress, such as the spacebar or return key).

example.code:
<button commandfor="mydialog" command="show-modal">
  Show modal dialog
</button>
<dialog id="mydialog">
  <button commandfor="mydialog" command="close">
    Close
  </button>
  *dialog content*
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <button commandfor="mydialog" command="show-modal"> Show modal dialog </button> <dialog id="mydialog"> <button commandfor="mydialog" command="close"> Close </button> *dialog content* </dialog>

entity.name: `element.before()`
entity.description: DOM method that moves an element before another.
entity.descriptionClean: DOM method that moves an element before another.
entity.descriptionHtml: DOM method that moves an element before another.

mdn.title: Element: before() method
mdn.summary:
The Element.before() method inserts a set of
Node objects or strings in the children list of this
Element's parent, just before this Element.
Strings are inserted as equivalent Text nodes.

example.codeHighlighted: referenceElement.before(newElement);

entity.name: `element.moveBefore()`
entity.description: Move an element before another while preserving state (focus, iframe loads, animation frame, etc).
entity.descriptionClean: Move an element before another while preserving state (focus, iframe loads, animation frame, etc).
entity.descriptionHtml: Move an element before another while preserving state (focus, iframe loads, animation frame, etc).

mdn.title: Element: moveBefore() method
mdn.summary: The moveBefore() method of the Element interface moves a given Node inside the invoking node as a direct child, before a given reference node.

example.codeHighlighted: referenceElement.parentNode.moveBefore(newElement, referenceElement);

entity.name: `<svg>` (Inline SVG)
entity.description: Embed SVG vector graphics directly in markup
entity.descriptionClean: Embed SVG vector graphics directly in markup
entity.descriptionHtml: Embed SVG vector graphics directly in markup

mdn.title: <svg>
mdn.summary: The <svg> SVG element is a container that defines a new coordinate system and viewport. It is used as the outermost element of SVG documents, but it can also be used to embed an SVG fragment inside an SVG or HTML document.

example.codeHighlighted: <svg> <circle cx="50" cy="50" r="50" /> </svg>

entity.name: `<canvas>`
entity.description: Element for drawing dynamic 2D or 3D graphics using JavaScript.
entity.descriptionClean: Element for drawing dynamic 2D or 3D graphics using JavaScript.
entity.descriptionHtml: Element for drawing dynamic 2D or 3D graphics using JavaScript.

mdn.title: <canvas>: The Graphics Canvas element
mdn.summary: Use the HTML <canvas> element with either the canvas scripting API or the WebGL API to draw graphics and animations.

example.codeHighlighted: <canvas width="200" height="200"></canvas>

entity.name: `colorSpace` for 2D canvas
entity.description: Set the color space for the graphics being drawn on a  `<canvas>` element.
entity.descriptionClean: Set the color space for the graphics being drawn on a  <canvas> element.
entity.descriptionHtml: Set the color space for the graphics being drawn on a <canvas> element.

mdn.title: HTMLCanvasElement: getContext() method
mdn.summary: The HTMLCanvasElement.getContext() method returns a drawing context on the canvas, or null if the context identifier is not supported, or the canvas has already been set to a different context mode.

example.codeHighlighted: const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d", {colorSpace: "display-p3"});

entity.name: `ctx.drawElement()` (HTML in canvas)
entity.description: Draw an HTML element on `<canvas>`,  with conveniences for redrawing and hit testing.
entity.descriptionClean: Draw an HTML element on <canvas>,  with conveniences for redrawing and hit testing.
entity.descriptionHtml: Draw an HTML element on <canvas>, with conveniences for redrawing and hit testing.

example.code: Hello world!
example.codeHighlighted: <canvas id="canvas" layoutsubtree="true"> <p>Hello world!</p> </canvas> <script type="module"> const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d"); const text = canvas.querySelector("p"); ctx.drawElement(text, 30, 0); </script>

entity.name: `<model>` (Inline AR/VR/3D content)
entity.description: Allows embedding 3D models in HTML with built-in controls.
entity.descriptionClean: Allows embedding 3D models in HTML with built-in controls.
entity.descriptionHtml: Allows embedding 3D models in HTML with built-in controls.

example.codeHighlighted: <model src="3d-assets/car.glb"></model>

entity.name: `navigator.xr` (WebXR Device API)
entity.description: Create AR/VR sessions with compatible output devices.
entity.descriptionClean: Create AR/VR sessions with compatible output devices.
entity.descriptionHtml: Create AR/VR sessions with compatible output devices.

mdn.title: WebXR Device API
mdn.summary: WebXR is a group of standards which are used together to support rendering 3D scenes to hardware designed for presenting virtual worlds (virtual reality, or VR), or for adding graphical imagery to the real world, (augmented reality, or AR). The WebXR Device API implements the core of the WebXR feature set, managing the selection of output devices, render the 3D scene to the chosen device at the appropriate frame rate, and manage motion vectors created using input controllers.

example.code:
const xr = navigator.xr;
const session = await xr?.requestSession("immersive-vr");
example.codeHighlighted: const xr = navigator.xr; const session = await xr?.requestSession("immersive-vr");

entity.name: WebGPU
entity.description: A JavaScript API that provides low-level access to the GPU for high-performance graphics and parallel computation in the browser.
entity.descriptionClean: A JavaScript API that provides low-level access to the GPU for high-performance graphics and parallel computation in the browser.
entity.descriptionHtml: A JavaScript API that provides low-level access to the GPU for high-performance graphics and parallel computation in the browser.

mdn.title: WebGPU API
mdn.summary: The WebGPU API enables web developers to use the underlying system's GPU (Graphics Processing Unit) to carry out high-performance computations and draw complex images that can be rendered in the browser.

example.code:
const adapter = await navigator.gpu.requestAdapter();
const device = await adapter?.requestDevice();
example.codeHighlighted: const adapter = await navigator.gpu.requestAdapter(); const device = await adapter?.requestDevice();

entity.name: WebGL
entity.description: A low-level API for rendering 2D and 3D graphics with the GPU on `<canvas>` , based on OpenGL.
entity.descriptionClean: A low-level API for rendering 2D and 3D graphics with the GPU on <canvas> , based on OpenGL.
entity.descriptionHtml: A low-level API for rendering 2D and 3D graphics with the GPU on <canvas> , based on OpenGL.

mdn.title: Getting started with WebGL
mdn.summary: WebGL enables web content to use an API based on OpenGL ES 2.0 to perform 2D and 3D rendering in an HTML canvas in browsers that support it without the use of plug-ins.

example.codeHighlighted: const gl = canvas.getContext("webgl");

entity.name: JPEG XL
entity.description: An image format optimized for web environments.
entity.descriptionClean: An image format optimized for web environments.
entity.descriptionHtml: An image format optimized for web environments.

example.codeHighlighted: <img src="image.jxl" />

entity.name: `<math>` (Inline MathML)
entity.description: Display math directly in HTML, using MathML.
entity.descriptionClean: Display math directly in HTML, using MathML.
entity.descriptionHtml: Display math directly in HTML, using MathML.

mdn.title: <math>
mdn.summary: The <math> MathML element is the top-level MathML element, used to write a single mathematical formula. It can be placed in HTML content where flow content is permitted.

example.codeHighlighted: <!-- x + 1 --> <math> <msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup> <mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn> </math>

entity.name: `<mapviewer>` (Inline MapML)
entity.description: Embed interactive maps in HTML.
entity.descriptionClean: Embed interactive maps in HTML.
entity.descriptionHtml: Embed interactive maps in HTML.

example.codeHighlighted: <mapviewer controls width="600" height="400"> <maplayer src="osm.mapml"></maplayer> </mapviewer>

entity.name: Content-Security Policy (CSP)
entity.description: A set of directives from a website to a browser, that helps to detect and mitigate XSS attacks.
entity.descriptionClean: A set of directives from a website to a browser, that helps to detect and mitigate XSS attacks.
entity.descriptionHtml: A set of directives from a website to a browser, that helps to detect and mitigate XSS attacks.

mdn.title: Content Security Policy (CSP)
mdn.summary: Content Security Policy (CSP) is a feature that helps to prevent or minimize the risk of certain types of security threats. It consists of a series of instructions from a website to a browser, which instruct the browser to place restrictions on the things that the code comprising the site is allowed to do.

example.codeHighlighted: Content-Security-Policy: script-src 'self';

entity.name: Sanitizer API
entity.description: `element.setHTML()` and `Document.parseHTML()`. API to prevent XSS attacks by sanitizing untrusted strings of HTML.
entity.descriptionClean: element.setHTML() and Document.parseHTML(). API to prevent XSS attacks by sanitizing untrusted strings of HTML.
entity.descriptionHtml: element.setHTML() and Document.parseHTML(). API to prevent XSS attacks by sanitizing untrusted strings of HTML.

mdn.title: HTML Sanitizer API
mdn.summary: The HTML Sanitizer API allows developers to take strings of HTML and filter out unwanted elements, attributes, and other HTML entities when they are inserted into the DOM or a shadow DOM.

example.codeHighlighted: greeting.setHTML('Hello ' + nameInput.value);

entity.name: `hidden="until-found"`
entity.description: Hide an element until it is found (e.g. via a find-in-page search or when targeted by the URL hash).
entity.descriptionClean: Hide an element until it is found (e.g. via a find-in-page search or when targeted by the URL hash).
entity.descriptionHtml: Hide an element until it is found (e.g. via a find-in-page search or when targeted by the URL hash).

mdn.title: HTML hidden global attribute
mdn.summary: The hidden global attribute is an enumerated attribute indicating that the browser should not render the contents of the element. For example, it can be used to hide elements of the page that can't be used until the login process has been completed.

example.codeHighlighted: <section class="drawer" aria-expanded="false" hidden="until-found"> <!-- content --> </section>

entity.name: `Intl.Segmenter` API
entity.description: Language-sensitive segmentation of text into graphemes, words or sentences.
entity.descriptionClean: Language-sensitive segmentation of text into graphemes, words or sentences.
entity.descriptionHtml: Language-sensitive segmentation of text into graphemes, words or sentences.

mdn.title: Intl.Segmenter
mdn.summary: The Intl.Segmenter object enables locale-sensitive text segmentation, enabling you to get meaningful items (graphemes, words or sentences) from a string.

example.codeHighlighted: const segmenterFr = new Intl.Segmenter("fr", { granularity: "word" }); const string1 = "Que ma joie demeure"; const iterator1 = segmenterFr.segment(string1)[Symbol.iterator](); console.log(iterator1.next().value.segment); // Expected output: 'Que' console.log(iterator1.next().value.segment); // Expected output: ' '

entity.name: `Intl.Locale` API
entity.description: The `Intl.Locale` API parses Unicode locale identifiers, with language, region, and script codes, such as `zh-Hans-CN` or `en-GB`.
entity.descriptionClean: The Intl.Locale API parses Unicode locale identifiers, with language, region, and script codes, such as zh-Hans-CN or en-GB.
entity.descriptionHtml: The Intl.Locale API parses Unicode locale identifiers, with language, region, and script codes, such as zh-Hans-CN or en-GB.

mdn.title: Intl.Locale
mdn.summary: The Intl.Locale object is a standard built-in property of the Intl object that represents a Unicode locale identifier.

example.codeHighlighted: const us = new Intl.Locale("en-US");

entity.name: HTML Modules
entity.description: Import HTML files via JS imports and access their elements and JS exports.
entity.descriptionClean: Import HTML files via JS imports and access their elements and JS exports.
entity.descriptionHtml: Import HTML files via JS imports and access their elements and JS exports.

example.code:
<script type="module">
	import { TabList } from "./tablist.html" with { type: 'html' };
	customElements.define("tab-list", TabList);
</script>
example.codeHighlighted: <script type="module"> import { TabList } from "./tablist.html" with { type: 'html' }; customElements.define("tab-list", TabList); </script>

entity.name: `<template>`
entity.description: A mechanism for holding HTML that is not to be rendered immediately but may be utilized later via JS.
entity.descriptionClean: A mechanism for holding HTML that is not to be rendered immediately but may be utilized later via JS.
entity.descriptionHtml: A mechanism for holding HTML that is not to be rendered immediately but may be utilized later via JS.

mdn.title: <template>: The Content Template element
mdn.summary: The <template> HTML element serves as a mechanism for holding HTML fragments, which can either be used later via JavaScript or generated immediately into shadow DOM.

example.codeHighlighted: <template id="counter"> <div class="counter">Clicked {{ times }} times</div> </template>

entity.name: `loading="lazy"`
entity.description: Load certain resources only when needed.
entity.descriptionClean: Load certain resources only when needed.
entity.descriptionHtml: Load certain resources only when needed.

mdn.title: Lazy loading
mdn.summary: Lazy loading is a strategy to identify resources as non-blocking (non-critical) and load these only when needed. It's a way to shorten the length of the critical rendering path, which translates into reduced page load times.

example.codeHighlighted: <img src="picture.jpg" loading="lazy" /> <iframe src="supplementary.html" loading="lazy"></iframe>

entity.name: `srcset` and `sizes` attributes
entity.description: Attributes that allow providing several source images with hints to help the browser pick the right one.
entity.descriptionClean: Attributes that allow providing several source images with hints to help the browser pick the right one.
entity.descriptionHtml: Attributes that allow providing several source images with hints to help the browser pick the right one.

mdn.title: : The Image Embed element
mdn.summary: The HTML element embeds an image into the document.

example.codeHighlighted: <img srcset="fairy-med.jpg 480w, fairy-large.jpg 800w" sizes="(max-width: 600px) 480px, 800px" src="fairy-large.jpg" alt="Elva dressed as a fairy" />

entity.name: ``
entity.description: The `sizes="auto"` attribute reserves layout space for an image before it loads, avoiding some layout shifts.
entity.descriptionClean: The sizes="auto" attribute reserves layout space for an image before it loads, avoiding some layout shifts.
entity.descriptionHtml: The sizes="auto" attribute reserves layout space for an image before it loads, avoiding some layout shifts.

mdn.title: : The Image Embed element
mdn.summary: The HTML element embeds an image into the document.

entity.name: `fetchpriority` attribute
entity.description: Allows specifying a hint to help the browser prioritize fetching various resources.
entity.descriptionClean: Allows specifying a hint to help the browser prioritize fetching various resources.
entity.descriptionHtml: Allows specifying a hint to help the browser prioritize fetching various resources.

mdn.title: HTMLImageElement: fetchPriority property
mdn.summary: The fetchPriority property of the HTMLImageElement interface represents a hint to the browser indicating how it should prioritize fetching a particular image relative to other images. It reflects the element's fetchpriority content attribute.

example.codeHighlighted: <img src="logo.svg" fetchpriority="high" />

entity.name: `blocking="render"`
entity.description: Block rendering (but not parsing) until certain resources have been loaded. Available on `<link>`, `<script>` and `<style>`.
entity.descriptionClean: Block rendering (but not parsing) until certain resources have been loaded. Available on <link>, <script> and <style>.
entity.descriptionHtml: Block rendering (but not parsing) until certain resources have been loaded. Available on <link>, <script> and <style>.

mdn.title: <script>: The Script element
mdn.summary: The <script> HTML element is used to embed executable code or data; this is typically used to embed or refer to JavaScript code. The <script> element can also be used with other languages, such as WebGL's GLSL shader programming language and JSON.

example.codeHighlighted: <script blocking="render" async src="async-script.js"></script>

entity.name: `<link rel="expect">`
entity.description: Block rendering until the element referenced by the `href` value is connected and fully parsed.
entity.descriptionClean: Block rendering until the element referenced by the href value is connected and fully parsed.
entity.descriptionHtml: Block rendering until the element referenced by the href value is connected and fully parsed.

mdn.title: HTML attribute: rel
mdn.summary: The rel attribute defines the relationship between a linked resource and the current document. Valid on <link>, <a>, <area>, and <form>, the supported values depend on the element on which the attribute is found.

example.codeHighlighted: <link rel="expect" href="#hero" blocking="render">

entity.name: Speculation Rules
entity.description: Hints for the browser to proactively download pages in the background to improve performance.
entity.descriptionClean: Hints for the browser to proactively download pages in the background to improve performance.
entity.descriptionHtml: Hints for the browser to proactively download pages in the background to improve performance.

example.codeHighlighted: <script type="speculationrules"> { "prefetch": [{ "urls": ["/about", "/pricing"] }], "prerender": [ { "where": { "href_matches": "^/product/\\d+$", "selector_matches": "a.nav-link" } } ] } </script>

entity.name: Using Custom Elements
entity.description: Using custom elements, that you or someone else defined.
entity.descriptionClean: Using custom elements, that you or someone else defined.
entity.descriptionHtml: Using custom elements, that you or someone else defined.

mdn.title: Using custom elements
mdn.summary: One of the key features of web components is the ability to create custom elements: that is, HTML elements whose behavior is defined by the web developer, that extend the set of elements available in the browser.

example.codeHighlighted: <my-switch start="On" end="Off">Wi-Fi</my-switch>

entity.name: Defining Custom Elements
entity.description: Defining custom elements for use by others.
entity.descriptionClean: Defining custom elements for use by others.
entity.descriptionHtml: Defining custom elements for use by others.

mdn.title: CustomElementRegistry: define() method
mdn.summary: The define() method of the CustomElementRegistry interface adds a definition for a custom element to the custom element registry, mapping its name to the constructor which will be used to create it.

example.code:
class MyElement extends HTMLElement {  }
customElements.define("my-element", MyElement);
example.codeHighlighted: class MyElement extends HTMLElement { } customElements.define("my-element", MyElement);

entity.name: Declarative Custom Elements
entity.description: Create web components declaratively through HTML, with or without JS.
entity.descriptionClean: Create web components declaratively through HTML, with or without JS.
entity.descriptionHtml: Create web components declaratively through HTML, with or without JS.

example.codeHighlighted: <definition name="progress-ring"> <template shadowmode="open"> <div id="base" role="progressbar" aria-valuemin="0" aria-valuemax="100" aria-valuenow="{{root.attributes.percentage.value}}"> <slot>{{ root.attributes.percentage.value }}%</slot> </div> <style>#base { /* ... */ }</style> </template> </definition> <progress-ring value="50"></progress-ring>

entity.name: Scoped Custom Element Registries
entity.description: Allow multiple custom element definitions for a single tag name to exist within a page.
entity.descriptionClean: Allow multiple custom element definitions for a single tag name to exist within a page.
entity.descriptionHtml: Allow multiple custom element definitions for a single tag name to exist within a page.

example.code:
const registry = new CustomElementRegistry();
registry.define('sub-element', SubElement);
example.codeHighlighted: const registry = new CustomElementRegistry(); registry.define('sub-element', SubElement);

entity.name: Shadow DOM
entity.description: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.
entity.descriptionClean: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.
entity.descriptionHtml: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.

mdn.title: Using shadow DOM
mdn.summary: An important aspect of custom elements is encapsulation, because a custom element, by definition, is a piece of reusable functionality: it might be dropped into any web page and be expected to work. So it's important that code running in the page should not be able to accidentally break a custom element by modifying its internal implementation. Shadow DOM enables you to attach a DOM tree to an element, and have the internals of this tree hidden from JavaScript and CSS running in the page.

example.codeHighlighted: this.shadowRoot = this.attachShadow({mode: "open"});

entity.name: Declarative Shadow DOM
entity.description: Define shadow trees with HTML, such as when server-side-rendering web components.
entity.descriptionClean: Define shadow trees with HTML, such as when server-side-rendering web components.
entity.descriptionHtml: Define shadow trees with HTML, such as when server-side-rendering web components.

example.codeHighlighted: <host-element> <template shadowrootmode="open"> <!-- Shadow content --> </template> </host-element>

entity.name: `slot` attribute
entity.description: Replacing predefined parts of a component UI with your own elements.
entity.descriptionClean: Replacing predefined parts of a component UI with your own elements.
entity.descriptionHtml: Replacing predefined parts of a component UI with your own elements.

mdn.title: HTML slot global attribute
mdn.summary: The slot global attribute assigns a slot in a shadow DOM shadow tree to an element: An element with a slot attribute is assigned to the slot created by the <slot> element whose name attribute's value matches that slot attribute's value. You can have multiple elements assigned to the same slot by using the same slot name. Elements without a slot attribute are assigned to the unnamed slot, if one exists.

example.codeHighlighted: <my-switch> Wi-Fi <i slot="start" class="icon-on">On</i> <i slot="end" class="icon-off">Off</i> </my-switch>

entity.name: `slotAssignment: "manual"` (Imperative slot assignment)
entity.description: A way to assign elements to slots manually via JS, so that slot assignment does not have to be managed by the component consumers.
entity.descriptionClean: A way to assign elements to slots manually via JS, so that slot assignment does not have to be managed by the component consumers.
entity.descriptionHtml: A way to assign elements to slots manually via JS, so that slot assignment does not have to be managed by the component consumers.

mdn.title: HTMLSlotElement: assign() method
mdn.summary: The assign() method of the HTMLSlotElement interface sets the slot's manually assigned nodes to an ordered set of slottables. The manually assigned nodes set is initially empty until nodes are assigned using assign().

example.codeHighlighted: this.attachShadow({mode: "open", slotAssignment: "manual" }); let headerSlot = this.shadowRoot.querySelector("slot[name=header]"); let header = this.querySelector("header"); if (header) headerSlot.assign(header);

entity.name: `ElementInternals`
entity.description: Assign hidden semantics to custom elements, facilitating accessibility and allowing them to participate fully in forms.
entity.descriptionClean: Assign hidden semantics to custom elements, facilitating accessibility and allowing them to participate fully in forms.
entity.descriptionHtml: Assign hidden semantics to custom elements, facilitating accessibility and allowing them to participate fully in forms.

mdn.title: ElementInternals
mdn.summary: The ElementInternals interface of the Document Object Model gives web developers a way to allow custom elements to fully participate in HTML forms. It provides utilities for working with these elements in the same way you would work with any standard HTML form element, and also exposes the Accessibility Object Model to the element.

example.codeHighlighted: this._internals = this.attachInternals(); this._internals.role = "progressbar";

entity.name: Reference Target API
entity.description: A way to redirect id references to a component to elements in its shadow DOM (for ARIA, labels, popovers etc).
entity.descriptionClean: A way to redirect id references to a component to elements in its shadow DOM (for ARIA, labels, popovers etc).
entity.descriptionHtml: A way to redirect id references to a component to elements in its shadow DOM (for ARIA, labels, popovers etc).

example.codeHighlighted: this.attachShadow({ mode: "open", referenceTarget: "real-input", }); this.shadowRoot.innerHTML = `<input id="real-input">`;

entity.name: `:has-slotted`
entity.description: CSS pseudo-class that allows targeting `<slot>` elements only when they have slotted nodes.
entity.descriptionClean: CSS pseudo-class that allows targeting <slot> elements only when they have slotted nodes.
entity.descriptionHtml: CSS pseudo-class that allows targeting <slot> elements only when they have slotted nodes.

mdn.title: :has-slotted
mdn.summary: The :has-slotted CSS pseudo-class matches when the content of a <slot> element is not empty or not using the default value (see Using templates and slots for more information).

entity.name: Landmark Elements
entity.description: `<aside>`, `<article>`, `<main>`, `<nav>`, `<section>`, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: <aside>, <article>, <main>, <nav>, <section>, etc.
entity.descriptionHtml: <aside>, <article>, <main>, <nav>, <section>, etc.

entity.name: `tabindex` attribute
entity.description: Make HTML elements focusable, allow or prevent them from being sequentially focusable.
entity.descriptionClean: Make HTML elements focusable, allow or prevent them from being sequentially focusable.
entity.descriptionHtml: Make HTML elements focusable, allow or prevent them from being sequentially focusable.

mdn.title: HTML tabindex global attribute
mdn.summary: The tabindex global attribute allows developers to make HTML elements focusable, allow or prevent them from being sequentially focusable (usually with the Tab key, hence the name) and determine their relative ordering for sequential focus navigation.

example.codeHighlighted: <div role="button" tabindex="0">Im Tabbable</div>

entity.name: `focusgroup` attribute
entity.description: Facilitate keyboard focus navigation using the keyboard arrow keys among a set of focusable elements.
entity.descriptionClean: Facilitate keyboard focus navigation using the keyboard arrow keys among a set of focusable elements.
entity.descriptionHtml: Facilitate keyboard focus navigation using the keyboard arrow keys among a set of focusable elements.

example.codeHighlighted: <div focusgroup="wrap horizontal"> <!-- child elements --> </div>

entity.name: `<search>`
entity.description: Semantic element for wrapping search UI.
entity.descriptionClean: Semantic element for wrapping search UI.
entity.descriptionHtml: Semantic element for wrapping search UI.

mdn.title: <search>: The generic search element
mdn.summary: The <search> HTML element is a container representing the parts of the document or application with form controls or other content related to performing a search or filtering operation. The <search> element semantically identifies the purpose of the element's contents as having search or filtering capabilities. The search or filtering functionality can be for the website or application, the current web page or document, or the entire Internet or subsection thereof.

example.codeHighlighted: <search> <form action="search.php"> <label>Find: <input name="q" type="search"></label> <button>Go!</button> </form> </search>

entity.name: File System Access API
entity.description: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.
entity.descriptionClean: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.
entity.descriptionHtml: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.

mdn.title: File System API
mdn.summary: The File System API  with extensions provided via the File System Access API to access files on the device file system  allows read, write and file management capabilities.

example.codeHighlighted: const handle = await window.showSaveFilePicker(); const writable = await handle.createWritable(); await writable.write("Hello, world!"); await writable.close();

entity.name: Web Share API
entity.description: Exposes a mechanism for sharing content to various user-selected targets.
entity.descriptionClean: Exposes a mechanism for sharing content to various user-selected targets.
entity.descriptionHtml: Exposes a mechanism for sharing content to various user-selected targets.

mdn.title: Web Share API
mdn.summary: The Web Share API provides a mechanism for sharing text, links, files, and other content to an arbitrary share target selected by the user.

example.codeHighlighted: navigator.share(shareData)

entity.name: `share_target` manifest field
entity.description: Lets a PWA receive data (text, files, URLs) shared from other apps via the system share dialog.
entity.descriptionClean: Lets a PWA receive data (text, files, URLs) shared from other apps via the system share dialog.
entity.descriptionHtml: Lets a PWA receive data (text, files, URLs) shared from other apps via the system share dialog.

mdn.title: share_target
mdn.summary: The share_target manifest member allows installed Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) to be registered as a share target in the system's share dialog.

example.codeHighlighted: "share_target": { "action": "/share", "method": "POST", "enctype": "multipart/form-data", "params": { "title": "title", "text": "text", "url": "url", "files": [{ "name": "image", "accept": ["image/*"] }] } }

entity.name: `file_handlers` manifest field
entity.description: Allows PWAs to register themselves as handlers for certain file types.
entity.descriptionClean: Allows PWAs to register themselves as handlers for certain file types.
entity.descriptionHtml: Allows PWAs to register themselves as handlers for certain file types.

mdn.title: file_handlers
mdn.summary: The file_handlers member specifies an array of objects representing the types of files an installed progressive web app (PWA) can handle.

example.label: manifest.json
example.codeHighlighted: "file_handlers": [{ "action": "/open-file", "accept": { "image/svg+xml": ".svg", "image/png": ".png" } }]

entity.name: `navigator.registerProtocolHandler()`
entity.description: Lets a web app register itself as the handler for certain protocols (like `mailto:` or `web+custom:`).
entity.descriptionClean: Lets a web app register itself as the handler for certain protocols (like mailto: or web+custom:).
entity.descriptionHtml: Lets a web app register itself as the handler for certain protocols (like mailto: or web+custom:).

mdn.title: Navigator: registerProtocolHandler() method
mdn.summary: The Navigator method registerProtocolHandler() lets websites register their ability to open or handle particular URL schemes (also known as protocols).

example.codeHighlighted: navigator.registerProtocolHandler("mailto", "https://fancywebmail.com/?compose=%s");

entity.name: Web Bluetooth
entity.description: Connect to and communicate with nearby Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) devices.
entity.descriptionClean: Connect to and communicate with nearby Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) devices.
entity.descriptionHtml: Connect to and communicate with nearby Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) devices.

mdn.title: Web Bluetooth API
mdn.summary: The Web Bluetooth API provides the ability to connect and interact with Bluetooth Low Energy peripherals.

example.code: const device = await navigator.bluetooth.requestDevice({ filters: [{ services: ["heart_rate"] }] });
example.codeHighlighted: const device = await navigator.bluetooth.requestDevice({ filters: [{ services: ["heart_rate"] }] });

entity.name: WebUSB API
entity.description: Directly communicate with USB devices, enabling data exchange without drivers or native apps.
entity.descriptionClean: Directly communicate with USB devices, enabling data exchange without drivers or native apps.
entity.descriptionHtml: Directly communicate with USB devices, enabling data exchange without drivers or native apps.

mdn.title: WebUSB API
mdn.summary: The WebUSB API provides a way to expose non-standard Universal Serial Bus (USB) compatible devices services to the web, to make USB safer and easier to use.

example.code:
const device = await navigator.usb.requestDevice({ filters: [{ vendorId: 0x2341 }] });
await device.open();
example.codeHighlighted: const device = await navigator.usb.requestDevice({ filters: [{ vendorId: 0x2341 }] }); await device.open();

entity.name: `SpeechRecognition`
entity.description: API that converts microphone input to text.
entity.descriptionClean: API that converts microphone input to text.
entity.descriptionHtml: API that converts microphone input to text.

mdn.title: SpeechRecognition
mdn.summary: The SpeechRecognition interface of the Web Speech API is the controller interface for the recognition service; this also handles the SpeechRecognitionEvent sent from the recognition service.

example.codeHighlighted: const rec = new SpeechRecognition(); rec.lang = "en-US"; rec.addEventListener("result", e => console.log(e.results[0][0].transcript)); rec.start();

entity.name: `PaymentRequest` API
entity.description: Enables a consistent, secure way for websites to request payments using the browsers native UI.
entity.descriptionClean: Enables a consistent, secure way for websites to request payments using the browsers native UI.
entity.descriptionHtml: Enables a consistent, secure way for websites to request payments using the browsers native UI.

mdn.title: PaymentRequest
mdn.summary: The Payment Request API's PaymentRequest interface is the primary access point into the API, and lets web content and apps accept payments from the end user on behalf of the operator of the site or the publisher of the app.

example.codeHighlighted: const request = new PaymentRequest( [{ supportedMethods: "basic-card" }], { total: { label: "Total", amount: { currency: "USD", value: "9.99" } } } ); let response = await request.show(); response.complete("success"));

entity.name: Web NFC
entity.description: Read from and write to NFC tags using a devices built-in NFC reader.
entity.descriptionClean: Read from and write to NFC tags using a devices built-in NFC reader.
entity.descriptionHtml: Read from and write to NFC tags using a devices built-in NFC reader.

mdn.title: Web NFC API
mdn.summary: The Web NFC API allows exchanging data over NFC via light-weight NFC Data Exchange Format (NDEF) messages.

example.codeHighlighted: const reader = new NDEFReader(); await reader.scan(); reader.onreading = e => console.log(e.message.records);
